thread.title: fifteenfortyseven Critical Systems Realty Hires Lauren Lemoi as Vice President of Marketing
thread.title_full: fifteenfortyseven Critical Systems Realty Hires Lauren Lemoi as Vice President of Marketing

author: Lauren Lemoi
title: fifteenfortyseven Critical Systems Realty Hires Lauren Lemoi as Vice President of Marketing
text:
fifteenfortyseven Critical Systems Realty (1547), a leading developer and operator of custom-designed datacenters, announces that Lauren Lemoi has joined the company as Vice President of Marketing. “This year we have seen significant advancement in our business model,” states Corey Welp, Managing Director of 1547. “The addition of a Vice President of Marketing further solidifies our commitment to developing our business. Lauren’s marketing expertise adds to our team’s level of professionalism and dedication.”
In this new role, Ms. Lemoi will lead the marketing initiatives of the company across various channels including corporate communications, investor relations and brand development. Prior to 1547, Ms. Lemoi was Director of Events and Account Director at Jaymie Scotto & Associates (JSA). At JSA she was responsible for developing and implementing strategic marketing plans which included brand launches for multiple datacenters and carrier hotels.
“I am excited to join the 1547 team of datacenter development professionals,” continues Ms. Lemoi. “As the datacenter industry sees further growth and demand it is an honor to be a part of a company that is shaping the landscape for connectivity.”
Ms. Lemoi is a member of the NY Tech Council and holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Communications from Wingate University.
To learn more about 1547, visit http://www.1547realty.com .
About fifteenfortyseven Critical Systems Realty
fifteenfortyseven Critical Systems Realty (1547) is a leading developer and operator of custom-designed datacenters. Formed by a group of experienced executives from the financial and datacenter industries, 1547 is investing in carefully selected datacenter properties. Together, the team has over 60 years of experience in operating, developing, and renovating datacenter space, along with extensive experience in performing exploratory market and feasibility due diligence studies. This wealth of experience allows 1547 to be well positioned to acquire, develop and operate strategically-located, custom built datacenter properties.
1547 is shaped by the team’s distinct but interrelated expertise, and has developed an extensive network of industry relationships. 1547 is building a unique and opportunistic portfolio of custom datacenters with a focus on the customer from concept through completion of each project. For more information, visit http://www.1547realty.com .
